document.title: International Versions of Microsoft's Windows XP

toc.envision_title: International Versions of Microsoft's Windows XP

keyword.term: Known Issues, International Versions of Windows XP

document.paragraph:
The documentation provided in this section instructs you on how to circumvent the Microsoft Visual Studio .NET installation issue on non-English versions of Microsoft's Windows XP to enable the use of EiffelEnvision from within Visual Studio .NET 2003 successfully. bypassing
2 Patching Visual Studio .NET 2003
The problem lies in the registration of msenvp.dll, located in your Windows XP installation Common Files folder. On English versions of Windows XP, this folder is typically located in 'C:\Program Files\Common Files.' However, the French version of Windows XP is typically located in 'C:\Program Files\Fichiers communs,' and it is this translation that the Visual Studio .NET 2003 installation does not account for.
To correct this issue, you will need to reregister msenvp.dll manually. To do this, open a command line console. This can be done using the Start Menu > Run (or use Ctrl+R), and typing
cmd.exe
in the field provided, and clicking Ok.
From the command-line console, navigate to your Windows XP Common Files folder , which should be a direct translation of Common Files in your chosen installation language. For the French edition of Windows XP you would navigate to this folder by typing the following into the command-line console and pressing Enter.
cd "C:\Program Files\Fichiers communs"
Now continue navigating to the 'Microsoft Shared\MSEnv' sub-folder.
cd "Microsoft Shared\MSEnv"
Located in the current folder should now be a file call msenvp.dll. You can confirm this by typing the 'dir' command followed by pressing Enter.
To register the DLL you will need to use the regsvr32.exe Windows registration tool. Type the following into the console and press Enter.
regsvr32 msenvp.dll
If registration succeeded, you will be presented with a Windows information dialog box confirming the success of the registration. Discard the dialog by clicking Ok. You will now be able to use EiffelEnvision successfully from within Visual Studio .NET 2003.
